What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: Historical knowledge about the Anglo-Saxon and Viking age and the relationships between Anglo-Saxons and Vikings.
I have learnt greatly about distinguishing historical facts from commercial fiction supposedly based on those facts. Surprisingly, I also feel that my essay writing skills have improved greatly.

We had some great field trips, especially the one to York which enhanced our learning experience. Reading primary sources like the Anglo-Saxon Chronicle and Beowulf was interesting and helpful. Most of us didn't come into this course with a lot of knowledge about this time period/these people so more lecture/instruction on the subject would have been helpful before diving into our own discussions.

Strengths: Exciting topic, given the hype from the TV series Vikings. The course is very illuminating about the culture and long-lasting effects of the Viking age in England. The course also helps hone critical thinking and strong analysis of primary sources. 

Weakness: The structure of the course is quite messy.
Yes but only if the course topic interests them. If not, the motivation to keep working may wane quickly.
